ygData.subject: Re: SV: Re: Skill Cap
ygData.msgSnippet: So what is the Aqualungs formula anyway??? ... From: Gazamel Prime  To:  Sent: Thursday, December 16, 1999 1:06 PM
ygData.messageBody:
So what is the Aqualungs formula anyway???
----- Original Message -----
From: Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 16, 1999 1:06 PM
Subject: Re: SV: [EQ_Tinkering] Re: Skill Cap


> From: Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...>
>
> I'm level 50 and my skill is 102.
>
> I just heard last night that aqualungs were no longer
> bugged, so I can start making them again. Woohoo!
> I've got some plat to burn, might as well make some
> more lungs that'll take me another month to sell.
>
> Gazamel Prime
> Gnome Warrior, Master Tinker
> Solusek Ro
>
> --- Quasinom de Plume <eqmailing@...> wrote:
> > Heh - of course this arguement could be fruitless is
> > the cap has already
> > been removed. Actually I'm surprised that more
> > gnomes haven't commented
> > about which cap is real.
> >
> > How about everyone on the list whose OVER lvl 16 and
> > has practiced
> > tinkering send a quick note and state what your
> > current skill in tinkering
> > is?
> >
> > For me - I'm lvl 27 and my skill is currently 65
> > (which incidently means
> > that the cap has been removed or the [(lvl-15)*5]
> > formula is incorrect.
> > The other cap formula suggests my limit is 122.
> > Unfortunately I do not
> > have enough cash to prove or disprove that number).
> > However I'm not sure
> > if it's "capped" at 65 - I just happened to stop at
> > that level. This
> > weekend I plan on practicing a lot more to see how
> > far I can raise it.
> >
> > QdP
> >
> > --- Joe D <joed@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > Conrad Lesnewski <clesnew@...>:
> > > > (Level - 15) * 5
> > >
> > > Diablokilr@...:
> > > > Level x 5 - 13
> > >
> > > "Duck season!"
> > >
> > > "Rabbit season!"
> > >
> > > "Duck season!"
> > >
> > > "Rabbit season!"
> > >
> > > My gnome is currently level 13. The only stuff
> > I've tinkered is the
> > > stuff
> > > that trivials at 50. When I hit 16, probably in
> > the next week or so, I
> > > can
> > > settle this. According to one of you, I should
> > max out at 55.
> > > According to
> > > the other, I should max out at 67.
> > >
> > > Joe D
> > >
> > <HR>
> > <html>
> > >
> >
